Text: ...Hah!

(Olivier's ancient style of swordsmanship... It may
not be as refined as Shadow'sâ€”)

(But when one thinks on just how far in the past it
dates back to, at the time it truly must've been a
peerless style that emerged as if from nowhere.)

(When I was young...before I became possessed...I had
only seen that style used in elven rituals.)

(It's not like I'd intended to remember it. But...
somehow the forms are coming back to me
as if I've known them all this time.)
...The blood of the heroes, huh.
Lady Alpha!
Beta?

I have a report from Zeta! She has apparently
obtained information on the Three Heroes!
Understood. I'll be there at onceâ€”

...Sorry to interrupt your training, but I figured
this was sufficiently urgent.
It's fine. So, let's hear your report.
...Zeta?
...No, it's nothing.
I tried tracing the steps of the hero Lili.

It's said that after Diablos' defeat, Lili traveled
around spreading the good word as an archbishop
of the Church...

...But in therianthrope society, aside from in a very
few tribes, you won't find a trace of this remaining.

It's almost the same with the elves. There are a few
individuals who join the Church, but it's not like
the Holy Teachings themselves receive any special
veneration in elven society.

You'd think that if Olivier was a paladin of the
Church, there'd at least be a few elves who
followed the Holy Teachings.

Exactly, Zeta. That's also part of why I looked into
the connectionâ€”

Beta's investigation of normal society came up empty-
handed...which means that our current course of
events has been deliberately concealed amid the
status quo.

And you're saying you've found this hidden
undercurrent.

...A therianthrope tribe that passed on Lili's
teachings and the original nature of the
Three Heroes did exist at one point.
*gasp*!

It was a tribe that told tales of the adventures of
Lili, one of the trio of warriors who fought Diablos.

And...these tales said that the heroes were female,
not male, and that possession was not a curse...
but a blessing.

You say this tribe existed "at one point in time,"
so does that mean they're now...?
Gone... Wiped out by the Cult of Diablos.
But then...!
Zetaâ€”

But, their worship of the hero Lili lives on. Worship
of the archbishopâ€”no, saintâ€”passed down only
among the chieftains.

This tribe of true believers may have been wiped from
existence...but there are still traces of them to be
found.

If that's true, then maybe if we keep sniffing around
in Midgar we'll find something on Freya too.
...Yes, that's true. Any thoughts, Zeta?

I've got eyes on some likely prospects, but I can't
say anything for now. But don't you worry, I'll find
something.

...It's as Shadow said. History has been deliberately
distorted by the Cult.

The reason for their meddling using the Holy
Teachings lies beyond where that elf stands
guard... In the depths of the Sanctuary.

...I believe I'd like to pay that place another
visit.

Partially to also see once more if we are able to
face her, face Olivier, as we are now.
Olivier?!
Lady Alpha, do you meanâ€”

This sense I have isn't based in reason. It may
be nothing more than a delusion on my part.

But the feeling burns strongly within me all the
same. That swordswoman is none other than Olivierâ€”
